title: Prompt builder three panel layout
content: Use a three panel layout with editor filters and preview

title: Progressive disclosure reduces cognitive load
content: Show the primary path first and reveal advanced controls when needed

title: Use one primary action button
content: Prefer a single primary CTA to clarify intent and reduce mistakes

title: Anti pattern auto run on every keystroke
content: Do not run expensive actions on each keystroke

title: Expose async states clearly
content: Show loading success and error states in place and keep messages visible

content: Use labels and aria attributes to make errors discoverable

title: Episode chip input testing improved UX
content: User testing showed keyboard shortcuts were required

title: Fix npm EACCES in node_modules on macOS
content: Resolve EACCES permission denied in node_modules during npm install by setting a user owned npm prefix and fixing cache ownership
triage_json: {"symptoms":["eacces","permission denied"],"likelyCauses":["wrong npm prefix"],"verificationSteps":["Run npm config get prefix"],"fixSteps":["Set prefix to user dir"],"gotchas":["Avoid sudo npm install"]}
summary: Fix EACCES permission denied while writing node_modules on macOS; avoid sudo and use a user owned prefix.
howToApply: npm config set prefix ~/.npm-global|export PATH=$HOME/.npm-global/bin:$PATH|sudo chown -R $(whoami) ~/.npm ~/.npm-global
gotchas: Do not sudo npm install|Check prefix is not /usr/local

title: Episode resolved npm EACCES for node_modules
content: Changed npm prefix and reinstalled dependencies successfully after EACCES in node_modules

title: Anti pattern using sudo with npm
content: Avoid sudo npm install; it creates root owned node_modules and hides the real permissions issue
antipattern_json: {"action":"Using sudo npm install","whyBad":"Creates root owned files and security risk","saferAlternative":"Fix prefix and cache ownership"}
summary: Using sudo creates root owned node_modules and recurring EACCES
gotchas: Fix prefix and cache ownership instead

title: Prefer explicit tool invocation
content: Use explicit user intent before running tools

title: Keep prompts short and structured
content: Structure prompts with headings and bullet lists

content: Include stable memory ids in injected context
